title: Leicester boss Claudio Ranieri laughs off being bookies' favourite for the sack as chairman flies in
text:
Sport Leicester boss Claudio Ranieri laughs off being bookies' favourite for the sack as chairman flies in Last season's title-winner "very confident" amid whispers of player unrest with the Foxes a point off the bottom three Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Ranieri turns the air blue as he's quizzed about relationship with his players Share this video Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Claudio Ranieri has laughed in the face of the mounting crisis engulfing Leicester City . 
The Foxes’ chairman Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha is flying in for Wednesday’s FA Cup replay at home to second-tier Derby to ­show his support for the under-fire boss. 
The club's wealthy Thai owner has also taken the unusual step of issuing a public statement backing the manager. 
Ranieri is the bookies’ favourite to be the next Premier League boss sacked despite last season's astonishing title triumph, with the champions now just one point above the bottom three and still without an away league win all season and a top-flight goal in 2017. Some would say Ranieri's problems are THIS big... (Photo: Plumb Images/Leicester City FC via Getty) 
The 65-year-old has been assured of “unwavering support” after a run of just one win in nine games which has plunged them into grave relegation danger. 
Leicester’s Thai regime stated: “The entire club is, and will remain, united behind its manager.” 
Ranieri responded: “I know the idea of the chairman of the club and everybody. I speak to the chairman all the time. Ranieri is preaching calm as Leicester struggle (Photo: Plumb Images/Leicester City FC via Getty) Read More As Ranieri gets one, seven managers sacked after the dreaded vote of confidence 
“My job is always the same – focus on the next match. For me it’s important to find the right solution for my players. I am very confident.” 
Leicester’s slump has sparked concerns among senior players at Ranieri’s frequent changes to team selection and tactics. And as the form has deteriorated, so moans from the dressing-room have increased. Read More All smiles with Jamie Vardy on the victory parade last May... (Photo: Plumb Images/Leicester City FC via Getty) ...despair for Vardy on Sunday as the champions lose yet again (Photo: Getty) Read More 
Criticisms have been made of Ranieri’s team selections, tactics — and even changes on the players' menu . 
He added: “I say to my players, ‘My door is always open’. 
“We speak all the time about what we need to improve with all my staff and everybody. Sometimes I come to them and sometimes they come to me. 
“Of course this season there is more pressure, but they understand. We stick together and are working to ­improve the situation.” poll loading Will Claudio Ranieri last the season as Leicester manager? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
